description: Generate multiple rest day UI prototypes on dev page for comparison

userStories.title: Create dev page scaffold for rest day prototypes
userStories.description: As a developer, I need a dev page to hold all rest day UI variations for comparison.
acceptanceCriteria: Create src/app/dev/rest-day/page.tsx
Page has toggle buttons to switch between Option A, B, C, D, E
Uses same styling pattern as other dev pages (dark bg, coral accents)
Add entry to DEV_PAGES array in src/app/dev/page.tsx
npm run typecheck passes
Page renders at localhost:3001/dev/rest-day
userStories.notes: Scaffold only - no actual rest day components yet

userStories.title: Option A: Minimal zen rest card
userStories.description: As a user on a rest day, I want a calm, minimal card that doesn't pressure me.
acceptanceCriteria: Create src/app/dev/rest-day/components/RestDayOptionA.tsx
Design: white/light card, subtle gradient, minimal text
Shows: 'Rest Day' title, encouraging 1-line message, next workout preview (small)
No CTAs except maybe 'View Next Workout'
Feels: calm, zen, permission to rest
Mobile-first, max-width container
npm run typecheck passes

userStories.title: Option B: Achievement celebration card
userStories.description: As a user on a rest day, I want to feel good about the work I've done this week.
acceptanceCriteria: Create src/app/dev/rest-day/components/RestDayOptionB.tsx
Design: celebratory, shows week progress prominently
Shows: 'You crushed it!' message, workout count this week (3/4 done), streak if applicable
Visual: progress bar or ring showing weekly completion
Optional confetti or subtle animation on load
Next workout teaser at bottom
npm run typecheck passes

userStories.title: Option C: Active recovery suggestions card
userStories.description: As a user on a rest day, I might want light activity options instead of full rest.
acceptanceCriteria: Create src/app/dev/rest-day/components/RestDayOptionC.tsx
Design: card with 2-3 optional activity tiles
Options: 'Log Nutrition', 'Light Stretch (10 min)', 'Train Anyway'
Each option is a tappable card/button
One option can be locked/premium (stretch video)
Clear that these are OPTIONAL - rest is fine
npm run typecheck passes

userStories.title: Option D: Coach wisdom card
userStories.description: As a user on a rest day, I want educational content about why rest matters.
acceptanceCriteria: Create src/app/dev/rest-day/components/RestDayOptionD.tsx
Design: card with rotating 'tip of the day' about recovery
Shows: tip icon, recovery fact/wisdom, source attribution
Examples: 'Muscle growth happens during rest, not during workouts', 'Sleep 7-9 hours for optimal recovery'
Subtle, not preachy - builds trust
Next workout preview below
npm run typecheck passes

userStories.title: Option E: Gamified rest card
userStories.description: As a user on a rest day, I want to feel like resting is part of the game/progress.
acceptanceCriteria: Create src/app/dev/rest-day/components/RestDayOptionE.tsx
Design: rest day as an 'achievement' or 'mission'
Shows: 'Recovery Mission' badge, XP or points for taking rest day
Progress indicator: 'Recovery: 0/24 hours' that fills over the day
Maybe: streak includes rest days ('7 day training streak' counts rest)
Gamified but not annoying
npm run typecheck passes

userStories.title: Option F: Social proof card
userStories.description: As a user on a rest day, I want to see that other users also rest.
acceptanceCriteria: Create src/app/dev/rest-day/components/RestDayOptionF.tsx
Design: shows community rest day activity
Shows: '2,847 others are resting today', or 'Top performers rest 2x/week'
Maybe: anonymous avatars of others resting
Normalizes rest, reduces guilt
Light, not heavy-handed
npm run typecheck passes

userStories.title: Wire up all options with toggle
userStories.description: As a reviewer, I need to easily switch between all options on the dev page.
acceptanceCriteria: Update src/app/dev/rest-day/page.tsx to import all 6 options
Toggle buttons show: A (Zen), B (Celebrate), C (Active), D (Coach), E (Game), F (Social)
Selected option renders below toggle
Mock data for: workoutsThisWeek=3, weeklyTarget=4, nextWorkout='Legs', streak=7
Page works on mobile and desktop
npm run typecheck passes
All 6 options render without errors
